member.name: P:Whetstone.Alexa.RequestAttributes.Data
member.summary: Free form class supplied in a Messaging.MessageReceived from a customer application.

member.name: T:Whetstone.Alexa.UserInformationPersistedEnum
member.summary: Used to indicate if the user data should be persisted or not when then the user disables the skill through a AlexaSkillEvent.SkillDisabledEvent.

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.UserInformationPersistedEnum.Persisted
member.summary: Returned if the user has made in-skill purchases that should be maintained.

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.UserInformationPersistedEnum.NotPersisted
member.summary: Returned if a new user id is generated when the user enables the skill again.

member.name: T:Whetstone.Alexa.AlexaRequestBodyAttributes
member.summary: If the Alexa skill can receive events if the AlexaSkillEvent is enabled on the Alexa skill.

remarks.para: This is used to process AlexaSkillEvent

member.name: P:Whetstone.Alexa.AlexaRequestBodyAttributes.AccessToken
member.summary: Passed in the account linking event notification. AlexaSkillEvent.SkillAccountLinked
member.value: The access token provided by the account linking process

member.name: P:Whetstone.Alexa.AlexaRequestBodyAttributes.UserInformationPersistenceStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets the user information persistence status. If it is NotPersisted then user data can be safely removed from storage. If it is Persisted, then user data with purchase history must be maintained.

member.name: P:Whetstone.Alexa.AlexaSessionAttributes.User
member.summary: Alexa user data, including the UserId.

member.name: T:Whetstone.Alexa.Audio.AudioPlayerActivityEnum
member.summary: Indicates state of the audio player interface
member.remarks: For more information see Audio Player Interface.

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.Audio.AudioPlayerActivityEnum.Idle
member.summary: AudioPlayer is only in an idle state when a product is initially powered on or rebooted and prior to acting on a Play directive.

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.Audio.AudioPlayerActivityEnum.Playing
member.summary: When your client initiates playback of an audio stream, AudioPlayer must transition from an idle state to playing.

remarks.para: If you receive a directive instructing your client to perform an action, such as pausing or stopping the audio stream, if the client has trouble buffering the stream, or if playback fails, AudioPlayer must transition to the appropriate state when the action is performed (and send an event to AVS). Otherwise, AudioPlayer must remain in the playing state until the current stream has finished.
Additionally, AudioPlayer must remain in the playing state when:

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.Audio.AudioPlayerActivityEnum.Stopped
member.summary: Default value of the request when starting a new session.

remarks.para: There are four instances when AudioPlayer must transition to the stopped state. While in the playing state, AudioPlayer must transition to stopped when:

item.description: An issue with the stream is encountered and playback fails
A ClearQueue directive with a clearBehavior of CLEAR_ALL is received
A Play directive with a playBehavior of REPLACE_ALL is received

remarks.para: While in the paused or buffer_underrun states, AudioPlayer must transition to stopped when a ClearQueue directive to CLEAR_ALL is received.
AudioPlayer must transition from stopped to playing whenever your client receives a Play directive, starts playing an audio stream, and sends a PlaybackStarted event to the AVS.

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.Audio.AudioPlayerActivityEnum.Paused
member.summary: AudioPlayer must transition to the paused state when audio on the Content channel is paused to accommodate a higher priority input/output (such as user or Alexa speech).
member.remarks: Playback must resume when the prioritized activity completes. For more information on prioritizing audio input/outputs. See Interaction Model

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.Audio.AudioPlayerActivityEnum.BufferUnderrun
member.summary: AudioPlayer must transition to the buffer_underrun state when the client is being fed data slower than it is being read. AudioPlayer must remain in this state until the buffer is full enough to resume playback, at which point it must return to the playing state.

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.Audio.AudioPlayerActivityEnum.Finished
member.summary: When a stream is finished playing, AudioPlayer must transition to the finished state. This is true for every stream in your playback queue. Even if there are streams queued to play, your client is required to send a PlaybackFinished event to AVS, and subsequently, transition from the playing state to finished when each stream is finished playing.

remarks.para: AudioPlayer must transition from finished to playing when:

item.description: The client receives a Play directive
The next stream in the playback queue starts playing (following a PlaybackStarted event).

member.name: T:Whetstone.Alexa.Audio.AudioPlayerRequestAttributes
member.summary: Contains the state of audio player on the user's device.
member.remarks: For more information about the audio player, see: https://developer.amazon.com/docs/alexa-voice-service/audioplayer.html

member.name: P:Whetstone.Alexa.Audio.AudioPlayerRequestAttributes.PlayerActivity
member.summary: Indicates the client status of the audio player. Defaults to Stopped on launch.

member.name: T:Whetstone.Alexa.BuiltInIntents
member.summary: Encloses the built-in intents supported by Alexa.

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.BuiltInIntents.CancelIntent
member.summary:
Either of the following:
Let the user cancel a transaction or task (but remain in the skill)
Let the user completely exit the skill

remarks.para: For skills that stream audio using the AudioPlayer interface, users can invoke this intent without using your invocation name if your skill is currently playing audio or was the most recent skill to play audio. The intent is sent to your skill in this case even if AMAZON.CancelIntent is not in your intent schema.
Common utterances are:

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.BuiltInIntents.FallbackIntent

summary.para: Provides a fallback for user utterances that do not match any of your skill's intents. Your AMAZON.FallbackIntent handler can give the user more details on what your skill does and how they can interact with it.

member.remarks: Utterances vary. This intent uses an out-of-domain model generated based on your interaction model. See Provide a Fallback for Unmatched Utterances. https://developer.amazon.com/docs/custom-skills/standard-built-in-intents.html#fallback

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.BuiltInIntents.HelpIntent
member.summary: Provide help about how to use the skill. See What Alexa Says (https://developer.amazon.com/designing-for-voice/what-alexa-says/) for guidelines about contextualized help.

remarks.para: Common utterances are:

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.BuiltInIntents.LoopOffIntent
member.summary: Lets the user request that the skill turn off a loop or repeat mode, usually for audio skills that stream a playlist of tracks.

remarks.para: For skills that stream audio using the AudioPlayer interface, users can invoke this intent without using your invocation name if your skill is currently playing audio or was the most recent skill to play audio. The intent is sent to your skill in this case even if AMAZON.LoopOffIntent is not in your intent schema.
The utterance is:

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.BuiltInIntents.LoopOnIntent
member.summary: Lets the user request that the skill turn on a loop or repeat mode, usually for audio skills that stream a playlist of tracks.

remarks.para: For skills that stream audio using the AudioPlayer interface, users can invoke this intent without using your invocation name if your skill is currently playing audio or was the most recent skill to play audio. The intent is sent to your skill in this case even if AMAZON.LoopOnIntent is not in your intent schema.

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.BuiltInIntents.NextIntent
member.summary: Let the user navigate to the next item in a list.

remarks.para: For skills that stream audio using the AudioPlayer interface, users can invoke this intent without using your invocation name if your skill is currently playing audio or was the most recent skill to play audio. The intent is sent to your skill in this case even if AMAZON.NextIntent is not in your intent schema.
Common utterances are:

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.BuiltInIntents.NoIntent
member.summary: Let the user provide a negative response to a yes/no question for confirmation.

remarks.para: Common utterances are:

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.BuiltInIntents.PauseIntent
member.summary: Let the user pause an action in progress, such as pausing a game or pausing an audio track that is playing.

remarks.para: You must implement this intent if your skill streams audio using the AudioPlayer interface. Users can invoke this intent without using your invocation name if your skill is currently playing audio or was the most recent skill to play audio.
Common utterances are:

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.BuiltInIntents.RepeatIntent
member.summary: Let the user request to repeat the last action.

remarks.para: For skills that stream audio using the AudioPlayer interface, users can invoke this intent without using your invocation name if your skill is currently playing audio or was the most recent skill to play audio. The intent is sent to your skill in this case even if AMAZON.RepeatIntent is not in your intent schema.
Common utterances are:

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.BuiltInIntents.ResumeIntent
member.summary: Let the user resume or continue an action.

remarks.para: You must implement this intent if your skill streams audio using the AudioPlayer interface. Users can invoke this intent without using your invocation name if your skill is currently playing audio or was the most recent skill to play audio.
Common utterances are:

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.BuiltInIntents.ShuffleOffIntent
member.summary: Lets the user request that the skill turn off a shuffle mode, usually for audio skills that stream a playlist of tracks.

remarks.para: For skills that stream audio using the AudioPlayer interface, users can invoke this intent without using your invocation name if your skill is currently playing audio or was the most recent skill to play audio. The intent is sent to your skill in this case even if AMAZON.ShuffleOffIntent is not in your intent schema.
Common utterances are:

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.BuiltInIntents.ShuffleOnIntent
member.summary: Lets the user request that the skill turn on a shuffle mode, usually for audio skills that stream a playlist of tracks.

remarks.para: For skills that stream audio using the AudioPlayer interface, users can invoke this intent without using your invocation name if your skill is currently playing audio or was the most recent skill to play audio. The intent is sent to your skill in this case even if AMAZON.ShuffleOnIntent is not in your intent schema.
Common utterances are:

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.BuiltInIntents.StartOverIntent
member.summary: Let the user request to restart an action, such as restarting a game, transaction, or audio track.

remarks.para: For skills that stream audio using the AudioPlayer interface, users can invoke this intent without using your invocation name if your skill is currently playing audio or was the most recent skill to play audio. The intent is sent to your skill in this case even if AMAZON.StartOverIntent is not in your intent schema.
Common utterances are:

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.BuiltInIntents.StopIntent
member.summary:
Either of the following:
Let the user stop an action(but remain in the skill)
Let the user completely exit the skill

remarks.para: Common utterances are:

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.BuiltInIntents.YesIntent
member.summary: Let the user provide a positive response to a yes/no question for confirmation.

remarks.para: Common utterances are:

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.BuiltInIntents.ScrollUpIntent
member.summary: For use with devices with screens. Scrolls the display up.
member.remarks: Scroll up in the display device, like Echo Show.

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.BuiltInIntents.ScrollDownIntent
member.summary: For use with devices with screens. Scrolls the display down.
member.remarks: Scroll down in the display device, like Echo Show.

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.BuiltInIntents.ScrollLeftIntent
member.summary: For use with devices with screens. Scrolls the display left.
member.remarks: Scroll left in the display device, like Echo Show.

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.BuiltInIntents.ScrollRightIntent
member.summary: For use with devices with screens. Scrolls the display right.
member.remarks: Scroll right in the display device, like Echo Show.

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.BuiltInIntents.PageUpIntent
member.summary: For use with display devices. Similar to the AMAZON.ScrollUpIntent.
member.remarks: Page up in a display device, like Echo Show.

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.BuiltInIntents.PageDownIntent
member.summary: For use with display devices. Similar to the AMAZON.ScrollDownIntent.
member.remarks: Page down in a display device, like Echo Show.

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.BuiltInIntents.MoreIntent
member.summary: For use with display devices. Similar to the AMAZON.ScrollDownIntent and AMAZON.ScrollRightIntent.
member.remarks: Page down or move right in a display device, like Echo Show.

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.BuiltInIntents.NavigateHomeIntent
member.summary: Navigate user to the device home screen. The skill session will end.
member.remarks: For use with display devices, like Echo Show.

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.BuiltInIntents.NavigateSettingsIntent
member.summary: Navigate user to the Device Settings screen, and the skill session will continue.
member.remarks: For use with display devices, like Echo Show.

member.name: T:Whetstone.Alexa.CanFulfill.CanFulfillEnum
member.summary: Used by the CanFullfillResponseAttributes to tell Alexa whether the intent is supported by the Alexa skill.

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.CanFulfill.CanFulfillEnum.Yes
member.summary: Use if your skill understands all slots, can fulfill all slots, and can fulfill the request in its entirety.

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.CanFulfill.CanFulfillEnum.No
member.summary: Use if your skill cannot understand the intent, and/or cannot understand any of the slots, and/or cannot fulfill any of the slots.

member.name: F:Whetstone.Alexa.CanFulfill.CanFulfillEnum.Maybe
member.summary: Use if your skill can understand the intent, can partially or fully understand the slots, and can partially or fully fulfill the slots.

remarks.para: The only cases where your skill should respond with MAYBE is when your skill can potentially complete the request if your skill get more data through a multi-turn conversation with the user. For example, if the skill understands the intent, such as orderCabIntent, but needs the customer to link their account before being able to fulfill the request. Another example is travelBookingIntent, where the skill understands a subset of all identified slots and needs more information before it can determine whether it can fulfill the intent for each slot value.

member.name: P:Whetstone.Alexa.CanFulfill.CanFulfillResponseAttributes.CanFulfill
member.summary: Must be set to string "YES" or "NO" or "MAYBE"

member.name: P:Whetstone.Alexa.CanFulfill.CanFulfillSlotResponse.CanUnderstand
member.summary: Serializes to "YES", "NO" or "MAYBE"

member.name: P:Whetstone.Alexa.CanFulfill.CanFulfillSlotResponse.CanFulfill
member.summary: Serializes to "YES", "NO" or "MAYBE"

member.summary: Contains type (which is PlainText or RichText) and text (which is a string). Limit of 8000 characters.

member.name: P:Whetstone.Alexa.Display.DisplayTextContent.TertiaryText
member.summary: Contains type (which is PlainText or RichText) and text (which is a string). Limit of 8000 characters.

member.name: T:Whetstone.Alexa.PermissionAttributes
member.summary: Alexa permission attributes coming in on an Alexa request.

remarks.para: This will be present if the user has granted the skill permission to access user information like the user name, email, etc.
For more information, the AlexaUserDataManager

member.name: P:Whetstone.Alexa.PermissionAttributes.ConsentToken
member.summary: This is used with the Alexa List management API.
member.remarks: If consent has not been granted, this value will not be present in the request.

member.name: P:Whetstone.Alexa.ProgressiveResponse.ProgressiveRequestDirective.Type
member.summary: The type must be set to "VoicePlayer.Speak" and it is by default. Do not change this.

member.name: P:Whetstone.Alexa.ProgressiveResponse.ProgressiveRequestDirective.Speech
member.summary: Can be plain text or SSML. If audio tags are included, the audio playback must be 30 sec. or less.

member.name: M:Whetstone.Alexa.ProgressiveResponse.ProgressiveResponseManager.SendProgressiveResponseAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sends a response to let the Alexa user know that the skill is working on the request.
member.param: This can be plain text or ssml. If it contains any audio MP3 files, they cannot take more than 30 secs. to play.

member.name: M:Whetstone.Alexa.Security.AlexaSecurityException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the System.Exception class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the System.Exception class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
Http status code of the Alexa Http response.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or a null reference.

member.name: P:Whetstone.Alexa.Security.AlexaSecurityException.StatusCode
member.summary: Status code of the Alexa http response.
member.remarks:
If the code is 403, then the user
Status Code Description
Unauthorized (401) The API authentication token is invalid or has expired.
Forbidden (403) API authentication token is valid, but access to the resource is denied. An appropriate response is to send a card authorization request.

member.name: M:Whetstone.Alexa.Security.AlexaUserDataManager.GetAlexaUserFullNameAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the user's full name if it is available.

member.name: M:Whetstone.Alexa.Security.AlexaUserDataManager.GetAlexaUserGivenNameAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the user's full name if it is available.

member.name: M:Whetstone.Alexa.Security.SecurityExtensions.HasAcceptedPermission(Whetstone.Alexa.AlexaRequest,System.String)

summary.para: Determines whether the SkillPermissionChanged or SkillPermissionAccepted includes the permissionScope.

member.param: The permission scope which should be restricted to the scopes defined in PermissionScopes
member.returns: true if the permissionScope is in included in the acceptedPermissions of the request body; otherwise, false.
member.exception: permissionScope cannot be null or empty or Request property on request cannot be null

member.name: T:Whetstone.Alexa.UserAttributes
member.summary: Represents the Alexa user. Encapsulates the UserId and the ConsentToken.

member.name: P:Whetstone.Alexa.UserAttributes.UserId
member.summary: Unique and immutable Alexa skill user id. Returning users can be identified using this value.

remarks.para: The UserId can be used to identify returning users. It cannot be used to identify users across multiple skills. This value is unique per user per Alexa Skill. If a developer has published multiple Skills and the same Amazon user launches each Skill, the single user will have a different UserId for each Skill.
Also, a new user id is generated if the user disables the Skill and enables the Skill again.

member.name: P:Whetstone.Alexa.UserAttributes.Permissions
member.summary: Permissions are populated if the user has granted the skill access to user information like email, address, etc.
member.remarks: If permissions have not been granted, this value will be missing from the response.

member.name: P:Whetstone.Alexa.ViewportAttributes.Keyboard
member.summary: The internal values of the keyboard object are unknown.
